description: Construction of a two storey and basement detached dwelling and sunken front garden, refuse storage and associated landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the exterior surfaces of the proposal shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details. Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004). | Details of the obscure glazed partially openable window on the north facing elevation including sections and manufactures details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding Arboricultural Report ER/TR/0110/2, prior to the commencement of the development, a revised tree report and a method statement setting out the measures to ensure full protection trees on site to BS 5837, and means of constructing the building and associated overground and underground services, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement which shall apply until the end of the construction period.  Reason: To prevent damage to the protected trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted UDP policies 4.1. 4.5 and 5.5. | The refuse and recycling store shown on the approved drawing ref: SV SRR 01 002 Rev: PO (received 07/12/2010) shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected, incorporating provision for soft planting to the front boundary wall. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5. | Details of an excavation and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  Reason:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.11 and 9.1.
